com.raweng.built.userInterface

Class BuiltUIListViewController

  • java.lang.Object
    • View
      • com.raweng.built.userInterface.BuiltUIListViewController

  • public class BuiltUIListViewController
extends View
    This class provides ListView with support of Built.io Backend SDK.
    Author:
    built.io. Inc
    Example
     // 'blt5d4sample2633b' is a dummy Application API key
 // 'project' is a uid of a class on Built.io Backend
 BuiltApplication builtApplication = Built.application(context, "blt5d4sample2633b");
 BuiltUIListViewController builtListViewObject = new BuiltUIListViewController(context, builtApplication, "project");
    
 setContentView(listviewproviderObject.getLayout());
    OR

    It can be added to any layout, such as:

      addView(listviewproviderObject.getLayout());

    Sample Code:
       builtListViewObject.setProgressDialog(progressDialogObject);
   builtListViewObject.setLimit(10);
   builtListViewObject.setPullToRefresh(false); //Default PullToRefresh is true.
   builtListViewObject.enableAutoScroll();
   builtListViewObject.enableSearchView();
   builtListViewObject.setSearchByUid("fieldUid");
   builtListViewObject.setListViewBackgroundColor("#d2b48c");
   builtListViewObject.getBuiltQueryInstance().includeOwner();
   builtListViewObject.setListViewDividerHeight(2);
   builtListViewObject.setSearchListViewDividerHeight(2);
   builtListViewObject.setListViewBackgroundColor(getResources().getColor(R.color.lighter_gray));
   builtListViewObject.setSearchListViewBackgroundColor(getResources().getColor(R.color.lighter_gray));
   builtListViewObject.loadData(new BuiltListViewResultCallBack() {

        @Override
        public void onError(BuiltError error) {}
    

        @Override
        public void onAlways() {}
    

        @Override
        public int getViewTypeCount() {

                return 1;
        }
    

            @Override
            public View getView(int position, View convertView, ViewGroup parent,BuiltObject object){
    

                    LayoutInflater inflater = LayoutInflater.from(context);
                    convertView             = inflater.inflate(R.layout.your_layout, parent, false);
                    TextView textView       = (TextView) convertView.findViewById(R.id.textview);
                    textView.setText(object.getString("name"));

                    return convertView;
            }
    

        @Override
            public int getItemViewType(int position) {

                    return position;
            }
    

  });

    • Constructor Detail

      • BuiltUIListViewController

        public BuiltUIListViewController(Context context,
                         BuiltApplication application,
                         java.lang.String classUid)
        Initialize BuiltUIListViewController instance.
        Parameters:
        context - set application context.
        application - initialized instance.
        classUid - string of class_Uid.

        Example :
          //'blt5d4sample2633b' is a dummy Application API key
  BuiltApplication builtApplication = Built.application(context, "blt5d4sample2633b");
  BuiltUIListViewController builtListViewObject = new BuiltUIListViewController(context, builtApplication, "classUid");

      • BuiltUIListViewController

        public BuiltUIListViewController(Context context,
                         BuiltClass builtClass)
        Initialize BuiltUIListViewController instance.
        Parameters:
        context - set application context.
        builtClass - instance of BuiltClass instance.

        Example :
         // 'blt5d4sample2633b' is a dummy Application API key
 BuiltApplication builtApplication = Built.application(context, "blt5d4sample2633b");
 BuiltClass builtClass = builtApplication.classWithUid(classUid);
 BuiltUIListViewController builtListViewObject = new BuiltUIListViewController(context, builtApplication, builtClass);

        public boolean deleteBuiltObjectAtIndex(int position)

        Parameters:

        Example
          builtListViewObject.deleteBuiltObjectAtIndex(1);
        Returns:
        returns true, if object deleted successfully; else, returns false.

        public void enableSearchView()

        Example

      • setPullToRefresh

        public void setPullToRefresh(boolean isPullToRefresh)

        Parameters:
        isPullToRefresh - true/false
        Default
        true

        Example
          builtListViewObject.setPullToRefresh(false);

      • enableAutoScroll

        public void enableAutoScroll()
        Loads the next object on scroll. If its disabled then user will have to pull-up the list from bottom to load next objects.

        Example
          builtListViewObject.enableAutoScroll();

      • loadData

        public void loadData(com.raweng.built.userInterface.BuiltListViewResultCallBack callback)
        Provides the list of BuiltObject
        Parameters:
        callback - BuiltListViewResultCallBack object to notify the application when the request has completed and provides getView().

        Example
          builtListViewObject.loadData(new BuiltListViewResultCallBack{
        

  @Override
        
  public void getView(int position, View convertView, ViewGroup parent, BuiltObject object) { }
        

  @Override
        
  public void onError(String error) { }
        

  @Override 
        
  public void onAlways() { } });
